title: Function keys sticking/stuck on keyboard
description:
**Problem:** Function keys (F1-F12) were sticking on the keyboard, causing issues during normal use.

**Solution:** Disabled all function keys permanently using xmodmap:
- Created ~/.Xmodmap configuration mapping F1-F12 to NoSymbol
- Applied configuration immediately with `xmodmap ~/.Xmodmap`
- Set up autostart via ~/.config/autostart/disable-function-keys.desktop to persist across reboots

**Impact:** Medium - keyboard hardware issue affecting daily workflow
**Resolution:** Permanent fix in place, function keys now disabled system-wide

title: Talon frequently misrecognizes words - manual correction workflow is tedious
notes:
## Specific examples from this session

- "christ mark" / "christa mark" / "chris mark" misrecognized instead of "question mark"
- "contact seven" / "context seven" misrecognized instead of "context7"
- "clothes" misrecognized instead of "close"
- "tail wind" misrecognized instead of "tailwind"
- "map server" misrecognized instead of "MCP server"
- "versal" misrecognized instead of "vercel"

## Current mitigation

- settings/words_to_replace.csv handles dictation replacements (free text only)
- For command misrecognitions (like symbols), need to add alternate spoken forms directly in the command definitions (e.g. symbols.py)
- Both approaches are manual — user has to notice the pattern, figure out the fix, and edit the right file

## The pain

- Misrecognitions break flow — you say something, wrong thing happens, you have to correct
- Different fix depending on whether it's dictation vs command recognition
- No automated detection of recurring misrecognitions
- Each fix requires editing a different file depending on the type

## Related work

- There's an idea bead (idea-7g7) for a "dictation coach" system that would auto-detect misrecognition patterns
- The concept: detect undo-then-retype sequences, tally corrections, suggest words_to_replace entries after N occurrences
- Estimated 8-12 hours to build

## What would help

- Automated misrecognition detection (the dictation coach idea)
- A unified "this was wrong" voice command that handles both dictation and command misrecognitions
- Better feedback loop: log what was heard vs what was intended
